headline: Chef John's Creamy Mushroom Pasta
description: This creamy mushroom pasta is Chef John's quick recipe for fettuccine pasta coated in an herby cream sauce made with sherry and 2 types of mushrooms.

video.description: This cream sauce stars two kinds of mushrooms, fresh herbs, and sherry
video.name: Creamy Mushroom Pasta

name: Chef John's Creamy Mushroom Pasta
recipeIngredient: 0.25 pound fresh shiitake mushrooms, stemmed and sliced
salt and ground black pepper to taste
9 tablespoons freshly shredded Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese, divided

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil. Cook fettuccine at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes. Drain but do not rinse pasta; transfer to a large serving bowl and keep warm.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir white and shiitake mushrooms in hot oil with a pinch of salt until liquid from mushrooms evaporates and mushrooms are browned, about 10 minutes.

Stir garlic into mushrooms and cook for 1 minute; pour in sherry and cook until wine is nearly evaporated. Stir in chicken stock; season with salt and black pepper. Bring to a simmer, reduce heat, and cook until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes.
Pour cream into mushroom mixture, stir to combine, and simmer for 5 minutes. Mixture will foam and thicken slightly.
Stir thyme, chives, and tarragon into mushroom sauce and turn off heat; mix 1/2 cup Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese into sauce until cheese is melted.
Pour 1/2 of the mushroom sauce over pasta; toss to coat. Top with remaining mushroom sauce and 1 tablespoon Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese.

review.reviewBody: If you make a rue(butter, flour, salt, pepper) add milk/cream then cheese untill melted, then add partly pre cooked mushrooms (seasoned with salt/pepper and garlic, add small amount of cream if heat too high to stop garlic burning) and half cooked pasta, or spaghetti /tagliatelle, put in oven at 180 degrees for 30 mins. Top with parsley, or use while cooking. Much better.
One of our favorite recipes!

If you like pasta and mushrooms I don’t see how you could not love this. I didn’t go completely by the recipe because of what I had on hand, but the recipe is an amazing base to build on! So so so good!!!!!

This is my new go to cream sauce! Absolutely love it and it's a big hit! Thanks Chef John. I'm loving your recipes, videos, humor and easy to follow directions!!!! And LOVE the app!!!! Especially being able to automatically change the ingredients with the serving sizes!!!

This recipe got such rave reviews I had to try it. Some people said it was watery, which wasn't the case for me because you do have to cook it according to the directions, step by step. My issue was with the tarragon and thyme...... I'm not a fan of tarragon, but because so many people said they liked it in this recipe, I decided to only put half of what should have gone into it, and the flavor was overwhelming even with only half..... it would have been so much better without both the thyme and the tarragon..... I felt like that almost ruined it.
Followed the recipe as directed but didn't have fresh thyme so I reduced the quantity but the thyme over powered the dish.

This dish was absolutely delicious. 
The End

Wow!!! This is the most flavorful pasta dish Ive ever had outside of a fancy restaurant! Creamy, tangy, cheesy, delicious! I added chicken which I cut up and stir-fried in butter, s&p and italian seasoning. The only other change I made was to thicken the sauce with 2Tbsp cornstarch after the addition of the stock. Then I substituted milk for the cream. Just what I wanted tonight! Thank you Chef John!
This came our very well plus the wife liked it.
This tasted great. It was a little soupy. I should have added a couple of tablespoons of flour to the mushrooms before I added the wine (I used Pinot Grigio because that's what I had).

I’m normally a purist and won’t review a recipe unless I make it 100% as written. However, Chef John, thank you, thank you, thank you! It is Morel season in Indiana. We were gifted a lovely morel and my daughter wanted Pasta with Morel Cream Sauce. We used this recipe, with just a few modifications and ended up with the most fantastic Bowties with Morel Cream Sauce. We used butter instead of olive oil, white wine instead of sherry, and of course our delectable morel instead of white and shiitake. Out of this world!! Thank you for another adaptable home run recipe.

Absolutely delicious! We made some minor adjustments to taste (only white mushrooms-no shiitake, used 18% coffee cream instead of whipping cream, no chives or tarragon) and it was over the top. It was SO good we made it twice in one day. It's on the menu for tonight and we can't wait!
Hubby said it can be added to the rotation, and there’s no better complement than that!
It was just awesome! Love the sauce
This was a delicious meal! The only 2 changes were substituting my favorite sweet Reisling for the sherry and substituting Asiago cheese for the Parmigiano-Reggiano. Can't wait to make it again!
Another Chef John favorite, this was amazing. Give it a try! YUM!!
Love this! Very tasty sauce. Since I didn't have heavy cream, I used plain yogurt and sour cream instead. I added ham chunks for protein. Will make this again. YUM!

This may have been the best thing I’ve every made. It did take more time than I anticipated for the mushrooms to cook but the recipe was accurate. Delicious I did not use 2 different kinds of mushrooms only because I needed to use up all of what i had on hand. I used cilantro also. Love Chef John’s sense of humor. I look for his videos. Thanks
Julie

It was very good. I followed the recipe and the tarragon was a bit too strong for my taste. I will definitely make it again and cut the tarragon in half and double the garlic. I always enjoy Chef John’s recipes.

Made the recipe without sherry and only 8oz of mushrooms instead of 1lb because that's what I had in the fridge. Turned out great anyway. Tasted great. Will definitely make it again with the proper amount of mushrooms.
Made a vegetarian version using portobello mushrooms and vegan chicken bullion. Used garlic confit instead of garlic. Made homemade fettuccine to go with it, holy cow!
Absolutely delicious, quick and easy. Thank you thank you!!
Delicious and easy! I made this with pasta water instead of cream (as one reviewer recommended) and it was still hearty and so tasty. Will make again!

Big Chef John fan here! I made this for my family, which includes one vegetarian member. Even though I substituted the chicken stock with homemade veg stock, it was delicious. Thanks chef John for your recipes. I can always count on them!

Haha - It's probably verboten to change a Chef John recipe around here, but what can I say, I'm a rebel. Serioulsy just couple changes to fit my diet and budget: 1. I used cremini mushrooms and baby bellas. 2. I use fat-free, half-and-half and it works fine. Thanks Chef John!
First time making a cream based pasta and it was a restaurant-stanard success. Thanks Chef John!
that was good.
Delicious! My vegetarian daughter and non-vegetarian husband raved about this. Didn’t change a think except serves over spaghetti. Thank you Chef John for another winner!

This was awesome! I used penne instead and mixed the pasta and sauce in the pan instead of pouring it on top. I also made the whole box and used all of the mushrooms instead of what was recommended and the sauce was still plenty. A touch more salt and pepper to taste and it was a great meal. Paired this with a cucumber salad.

This recipe kills it for creamy-mushroom cravings. It's a standard, so you can add more herbs or more cheese as you like, but the basics are easy and so so good. Just add a glass of wine and a simple salad for total satisfaction.

I followed the recipe, and it was phenomenal! You must use fresh herbs, or don’t even bother making it. The sauce was light, subtle, and beautifully flavored. I doubled the sauce ingredients and served this as a side with grilled chicken and sautéed string beans. It was an impressive dish, and it is worth making again and again!

This is the first recipe from Chef John that I didn't care for. It's clearly a personal thing because my guest liked the dish and said so. I, on the other hand, didn't like the herb combination and especially not the cheese. Had I not included the herbs or cheese, it would have been a delicious dish (I liked the method for cooking the mushrooms). Another disappointment was the clean-up. The cheese made clean-up a chore. The next time I want a mushroom sauce, I'll make the first half of the recipe and not include the herbs and cheese. Sorry, Chef, but I love your other recipes!
Turned out great! Subbed white wine for the sherry. Definitely making this again.
I only made enough for myself so I didn’t measure anything, I used the LARS method, looks about right system. I did add 2 slices of chopped pre-cooked bacon. I thought it was fabulous
Yummy comfort food. A treat with red wine.

This is my go to recipe! It's pretty versatile too. No wine or sherry on hand, no problem, still good without.

If I have prosciutto and/or spinach on hand, throw it in as the end, yummy!
The Thyme ruins this sauce in my opinion. It has an amazing base and wonderful ingredients EXCEPT for the thyme.

Good starting point. I made it as a side dish to a ribeye steak. Cut the chicken stock to about 1/4 cup. Added 1/4 tsp. fresh ground nutmeg with the heavy cream. Added 1/2 tsp. crushed dry rosemary to the sauce 2 minutes before the end of cooking. Cooked and plated pasta placing sauce on top. Used no other herbs or parmesan on top. Just added fresh ground black pepper upon plating.
sooooo good
Made it and I LOVED it! It was creamy without tasting heavy! Really mild but flavorful - I did not deviate from the recipe, and I will definitely make it again!

This was really great. I made it a few weeks ago, but will again. I think I used 1/2 and 1/2 b/c that was what I had on hand and a mix of mushrooms I found at the store. We (other than my picky daughter) loved this meal. Great for our meatless Monday meal. Chef John rocks!

We left out the sherry, since we're an alcohol free house, but the dish was delicious nonetheless! We found a chicken and mushroom broth that added to the earthy mushroom flavor. Next time I'll try increasing the volume of liquids to get a more saucy pasta.

We added diced up chicken thighs to the recipe but made no other adjustments. All three of my children loved it and the smallest refuses to eat almost anything (tough critic). So I am saving this recipe with much gratitude and will make it again in the future.

We loved the simplicity and the rich flavor of this recipe from Chef John! I had no sherry, so substituted a lovely white wine. In addition, I am dairy intolerant, so used a cup of coconut cream instead. This was an easy, wonderful meal. Will definitely make this again!

Love this recipe! It was so flavorful and easier to make than other similar recipes that this recipe will be my "go to" for fettuccine. I used only regular button mushrooms and then I added chicken breast and steamed broccoli when the sauce was completed for a full meal. There was not a drop left for leftovers!
Perfect! Made it for Lent!

This recipe needs quite a bit of help. Leave out the broth as it makes the sauce way too runny, use dry white wine instead of the too sweet sherry, add lots more garlic, and it needs something umami, I used Worcestershire. With those changes, this is super yummy. 
Or you can simply just find Emeril Lagasse's Emeril's New New Orleans pasta recipe and substitute mushrooms for all the protein .
I added more garlic (we love garlic) but that's all. This is an excellent recipe and everyone will enjoy it.
I made this with mushroom fettuccini from Aldi. Mmmmm

Wanted to thank chef John. Delicious sauce! Will make again. Only Baby Bella and white mushrooms at grocers. Used 1/2 lb of each. Mushrooms in broth would not thicken even slightly. Added about 3 oz or cream cheese (cubed very small) heated, melted into sauce and proceeded with rest of recipe.

 I tossed my home made fettuccini with some butter & parmesan and 1/4 C chopped parsley. Then sauced over with added sprinkle of parsley garnish. This was just great and disappeared immediately. Next time I might do a bit more than one lb. of mushrooms. This is a keeper
i didnt have any sherry :) but it turned nicely ...i loved da video too

Delicious!!! Only adjustment I made was adding a shallot and drizzling some white truffle oil add the end, so amazing! Modified herbs to sage and thyme as that’s what I had on hand, a definite repeat!

i pretty much followed recipe as is except used less cream then added sour cream. maybe too much. mine was a little dry. next time more cream. it was very tasty. i recommend you give it a try especially if you enjoy mushrooms like I do.
Chef John never disappoints. I didn't have fresh herbs, so I used dried. Still so good. I added grilled chicken for a very satisfying meal.

This was my first attempt at mushroom sauce, 
and it was amazing! Wouldn't do anything differently, everything was just right.
Delicious!
Made exactly as written We loved it! I used 1 box of white mushrooms and 1 box of assorted. Will make it again for meatless Friday.

I made this with the bare minimum as I was clearing out the fridge. No shitakes, only crimini mushrooms that were on their last legs and needed to be used. Also, I only had dried herbs and half and half cream. Even with that it was very good. I did double the garlic (always do) and perked it up with some wild mushroom and sage olive oil I had on hand. Next time I will try and make it with the shitakes and all fresh ingredients . Don't skimp on the cheese! I could also see incorporating some grilled chicken breast if you increased the amount of sauce. Chef John delivers consistently impressive and reliable recipes. He's worth following!
If you love mushrooms this is for you. What a nice change!
This is a very easy, delicious busy day dinner. On the table in less than half an hour. If you don't have fresh herbs, it's still very tasty using dried (at the time you add the broth).

I made this but changed the ingredient amounts a bit and added some cream cheese. I used the same amt of mushrooms, but decreased the cream to 5 oz, upped the sherry to 3 oz, used No-chicken broth, used dried herbs as follows: 2 tsp dried chives, 2 tsp dried tarragon, 1/4 tsp dried thyme and added 2 heaping Tbsp of whipped cream cheese. I also added 2 Tbsp butter to the pasta before adding the mushroom sauce. I also added 3/4 cup frozen peas (thawed/warmed in the microwave before adding). It came out amazing! Thank you for a wonderful basic mushroom-alfredo sauce which I could manipulate and make my own. I called mine Fettucine De La Nona!
Another win from Chef John. I made 4 servings, I used white wine instead of sherry, added chicken and omitted garlic. So yummy!

So tasty! The only thing I had to do was sprinkle some flour into the pan and stir well to thicken the sauce before serving. I will add this to my repertoire of Vegetarian-friendly dishes. Thanks Chef John. ????

I did not have any shiitake mushrooms, so I substituted a huge Portobello mushroom cut into pieces, along with white mushrooms. The recipe was great and I used spaghetti because I did not have the pasta that Chef John called for. The flavor was great.

I really like the way the flavors come together - makes the sauce a lot more interesting than just plan alfredo. I couldn't find fresh tarragon at the store, so I left that out, but had some fresh parsley handy, so I added that instead. It could also work with some bacon or chicken mixed in. I may try that next time.

An amazing recipe. I have made it 3 times and it gets better each time. Make sure you allow enough time for the mushrooms to properly cook so all the water evaporates. This is not a quick recipe but it is really worth the effort, which is mostly just giving it enough time.
Wonderful my family loved it

I followed the directions as written, and it was very good. I personally will use less mushrooms and omit the tarragon next time. We had a lot of mushrooms left over after everyone picked around them. But loved the mushroom flavor they gave. Thanks for the recipe.

Chef John, I don't know who you are but I love you and your recipes. This was SOOOO good my whole family ate it. (very picky eaters) I did not have sherry so I replaced it with red wine vinegar. Wow. Superb.
This is delicious. I've made this twice and added some sauteed chicken sausage to it so it was the main meal the second time.
Excellent!! No cream in the house so I heated some milk with a dab of butter instead and it worked out great. Family devoured it and I'll definitely make it again!
We loved it! We did upgrade the wine. It was great.
I didn’t have all the fresh herbs, so I used a few shakes of Italian herb mix and it was still wonderful. I also used a mix of mushrooms from the farmers market. Yummy!!

I made this exactly as directed and was please. My personal tastes think it was a little too much mushroom and possibly needed a little more “spice”. Definitely going to make again and try to adjust it just a little. All in all a wonderful recipe. Thank you Chef John. I look forward to trying some more of your recipes.
Very delicious!
Made as directed. Definitely a make again.

This was delicious! I've made some few alterations. Since I was out of fettuccine, I've use spaghetti. Instead of sherry, I've used red cooking wine. I didn't have any chives and skipped it. I would make it again.

This was even better than i thought it was going to be, and i thought it was going to be really good. Cream-based sauces can be so heavy, but this one really wasn't. I can't agree with the reviewers who say the dish is bland. I thought that the flavors were subtle, sure, but the mushrooms lent a beautiful depth to the sauce. You can adjust the amount of the seasoning and a bit more salt can do wonders.

Changes: I used a full pound of white mushrooms and cooked the sauce on low for an additional ten minutes beyond the time stated in the recipe in order to thicken it up. Used a Lustau amontillado sherry, which is darker than the fino variety.

Awesome recipe, made it four times already. Chef John is my go to guy for recipes on here. This is the second dish of his I’ve made, first was his chicken, sausage, peppers & potatoes dish which has become a staple dish in my home.

I only had white mushrooms and used white cooking wine instead of sherry. I threw in some roughly chopped sundried tomatoes near the end and it brightened it up beautifully! Great (and forgiving) recipe!

I followed the recipe as usual the first time. It was delicious, and I will definitely be making this again. I must admit, my mushrooms were watery too, as mentioned in another's comments, and I did cook the mushrooms until they were Brown and I could smell their nutty aroma. So I drained off the liquid before continuing on with the recipe. Even with doing that, it was still not as thick as I like, so I added just a hint of corn starch, and that thicken it up perfectly. Thank you for sharing, it's a keeper!

Fantastic if you like mushrooms which our fam does. I didnt have taragon or chive and used 3/4 tsp dried thyme and it turned out very tasty. Cooked a few mins longer to thicken more before adding parm and it was borderline too thick. Gave a good coating to the spiral pasta. Stick with the times suggested and have faith and should have a nice creamy sauce. Cant wait to make again with all the proper flavors!!

I had the most amazing meal last night and this was it! Everything about it was divine. I followed the recipe to the T... except I didn't have any tarragon, so I left that out. I used fresh herbs from my garden which made the meal even more special. I served it is a sweet Italian sausage link to make it a little more sustaining for me. Delish! Post a pic? Please... this didn't last long enough to take a pic.
I did stray from the recipe a bit (just my nature), but was quite pleased with the outcome.
Very pleasant and will go into rotation. Traded out a few spices and it was still excellent so it is pretty forgiving

YUM! Chef John really rocked this one. Seeing as I’m not a vampire, I doubled the garlic. I confess, I also added extra mushrooms. The only bad thing was how quickly it was consumed. Only a tiny tad was left which is a shame as it is even better the next day. Must make again SOON!

It tasted good but was difficult to make due to so many steps. I learned something about sautéing mushrooms with patience. I couldn’t find nice fresh chives so I used dried I wasn’t sure how much to use or perhaps to put in earlier - the taste was mild. I also used vegetarian stock so maybe that was not so wonderful.

I never make changes! I try the recipe as is. That’s the point? Right? 
This was really good - chef Johns recipes are always great. 
If you’re tempted to make changes then submit your own recipe. 
I get so frustrated with reviews that alter everything and end up with a recipe of their own. 
Seriously, fellow foodies!!! Submit your own recipe!!! 
Thanks chef John for another truly delectable recipe!! 
PS - to all the cooks who change every thing or don’t follow instructions - try it as is!!! If you don’t have ingredients called for / go to store or start over and submit your own recipe!!!!

Use fresh herbs as called for. Use Sherry, not cooking Sherry / it’s not the same. 
Find Shitake mushrooms/ they are available in most larger grocery stores / they add a distinct and flavorful addition, coupled with the simple button mushrooms it’s the perfect combo. 
The flavor is incredible combined with all of the other ingredients.
Perfect and I will make this again. I used beef stock because it’s all I had handy. My 9 year old loved it.

I love mushrooms and you can use any combination you like. It was filling but you didn’t feel like it was to much. My husband and I are the ones who like mushrooms so I saved for when we were alone. I would definitely make again and if anyone likes meat they can always add chicken but I prefer mushrooms only and extra cheese. I’m taking leftovers for lunch. Yum
Delicious! I didn’t have fresh chives on hand so I sauted diced onions with the mushrooms instead. This recipe is a keeper!

I loved the sauce, but the time for the fettuccine was wrong,it said 8 minutes (maybe for fresh that was right but not for box), I cooked it for 10 but it should be 12 for box....I will make it again, but please state fresh time and dry time.
Loved this. Didn’t change a thing. Wonderful depth of flavor.
My daughter and me devoured it. Did not remit anything, and it turned out wonderful!
Delicious. Didn’t have thyme or tarragon. Made it anyway My husband ate all of it. Didn’t even get a second taste. Maybe next time!
I added oyster mushrooms for a stronger mushroom flavor. Came out fantastic.
The tarragon really makes the whole dish pop. Highly recommend for mushroom lovers.
I will make it again added one can of shiitake mushroom soup and a can of golden mushroom soup

This was very, very good. I'd make it again in a heartbeat . Takes a little longer to cook, they must have a range with faster simmer:) 
Worth the effort!!
